channel.title: Old modems 14.4 - 56kbs
channel.description:
Question: What are they still good for, excluding the bin?
I must have 10 14.4kbs and 7 56kbs sitting here in my draw, accluminated over th last 10 or so years.
Is there any point of them still being there? am i holding on to pointless possesions?
i think so
/discuss

item.title: Old modems 14.4 - 56kbs
item.dc:creator: @sup000 sup000
item.description:
@sup000 wrote:

ebay link

look, $175!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Old modems 14.4 - 56kbs
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I found a box the other day for a ‘super fast 56k modem’.

Read full topic

item.title: Old modems 14.4 - 56kbs
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Lmfao, I remember the 14.4 kB/s’s and the 56Ks because I had AOL for the longest time (up until about 3 months after I join up here) and it sucked horribly.

Read full topic

item.title: Old modems 14.4 - 56kbs
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:11, topic:135852”]I thought the definition of antique was to be 100 years old +

Well not exactly the definition, i just dont think atari’s will be worth alot untill another 50 years have passed.[/quote]

Probably a lot longer than that, you’d be surprised how many people still have them kicking about. I have a broken 600XL sitting in the loft with my Amiga 500, C64 and stacks of copied games (see, those days piracy involved actually swapping copied tapes instead of this BitTorrent shit :p).

EDIT: I just want to point out that although I played all these machines when I was a kid, I’m not that fuckin’ old.

Read full topic

item.title: Old modems 14.4 - 56kbs
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

i think an antique is defined as an old thing :P, but in 50 years they will all seem like the crudies veideo game ever. also, you can play the games online.

Read full topic

item.title: Old modems 14.4 - 56kbs
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

[quote=“sup000, post:8, topic:135852”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=187327.msg1692280#msg1692280 date=1187815871]

the only thing i have ever found half interesting to do with LEDs is to replace the ones in your mobile phone with super bright ones, but unfortunatly these are not and my creativity is lacking to find some other use.

Ebay collectors pack. Meh maybe ill put my 2 Atari 600s with them too!

Don’t do that! Give one to me My Atari died a while ago

I miss Defender.
[/quote]

i only have Centapeid (sp?) and Space Defender /cry

i cant wait until it all becomes antique :)[/quote]
im pretty sure it is an antique already

also, chuck out the modems

Read full topic

item.title: Old modems 14.4 - 56kbs
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

attach them all together and you will get yaself a nice 536kbps // in my dreams.

Perhaps you should burn them? Or if they have LED’s in them, take them out and make something pretty with them.

item.title: Old modems 14.4 - 56kbs
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

they are good for absolutely nothing impress your friends and tell them about the time before cable and 56k, surprisingly if you where not into computers back then most people would have no idea what your talking about
